reviewText: Bellydance for Body Shaping uses bellydance floorwork moves as a foundation for a fun yet challeging workout. The atmosphere is lovely, the music fantastic, and the instructor Tanna is great. She is personable and clear throughout her insrtuction. This DVD has complete warm-ups and cool-downs, including an introduction about the muscle groups used. Tanna makes sure you do each excercise properly so you don't put strain your back, hips, or knees. The workouts are broken down into 3 sessions. As each session progresses, the next is a bit more challenging. Tanna gives a short performance incorporating the moves at the end of each session.With such a great production, I am not sure what happened with some of the camera-work. You can tell the camera is hand held through parts of the DVD, giving you that slight bobbing feeling. And in the beginnging, it seemed like the camera person is too close to Tanna and can't get her quite into the whole shot, so they angle it. At this angle (tilt your head to one side), it is very distracting when you are trying to follow along. Luckily, this is not the case through the whole DVD.This DVD is perfect for someone who wants to try something different and fun, strengthen the upper body, or learn some slinky dance moves. Sorry to say, I would not recommend this if you are seriously interested in learning traditonal bellydance floorwork. You might like to try "Classic Cabaret Floor Work."
summary: Understand this is a Challeging & Fun Workout - Not a Guide to  Traditional Bellydance Floorwork

reviewText: Floor work is incredibly hard on your body.  While it is a challenging workout, I don't think it's something people should do every day for "fitness" if they plan on using their body for a normal life span!  Tanna does give some safety suggestions, I wish she had spent a little more time discussing how to safely do a back bend, strengthening and stretching exercises etc. beyond "if it hurts, stop!"  Overall, I think this DVD would have been better if she focused more on the nuances and conditioning specifically for the floor rather doing a general fitness warm-up/cool-down with floor work in between.I wish she taught more practical elements of floor work, such as different ways to get up and down from the floor gracefully, how to position yourself so you don't accidentally flash the audience, costuming suggestions, etc.  Another caveat--some of the music reminds of the theme song to "Twin Peaks" and isn't particularly belly dance-y.  There isn't a lot of technique in here, and the three routines are basic and rather similar to each other.If you are an intermediate belly dancer in decent shape, with good knees and back, this is worth a try, but be safe!
summary: Looking for a belly dance workout that will simultaneously ruin your knees and back?  Then floor work is for you!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I wanted to give this DVD 3 stars but took off one for the simple fact that Tanna does not put any effort in telling the viewer that certain moves that are executed on the floor are just plain dangerous.....The two stars I did give were for the ideas of the DVD and the setup....I did not think that Tanna was an experienced enough dancer, I get the feeling that her experience is a tad too fresh, young, I feel she has not been doing this long enough to teach so openly, on a dvd, floorwork is a very dangerous dance... She moves from one move to another at an extreme pace, that floorwork is not !! If in fact she has been dancing for longer than I think then I apologise, this is just the feeling I have when observing her.That said...I'm a Belly dancer and was feeling ready to move onto floordancing. I was looking for something to help build up muscular support to properly perform a floordance. This DVD pretty much has it all, alot of what is done in the, NON instructional, workout is floor exercising, muscle toning around the legs, lower back, abdominal and arms, I praise the ideas and exercises shown.If you are new to floor dancing I would not suggest this DVD, unless you have prior Yoga and Pilates experience. Although this DVD is for strengthening the muscle groups needed for dancing on the floor my personal observation of this is that you need to have some muscle control already in order to execute these moves..... As I said at the start there are some potentially dangerous moves on this DVD and if you are unaware of them you're bound to hurt yourself before you get started.All in all if you are aware of the dangers and you have strong muscles and a little experience behind you I would recommend this DVD.
Title: N/A

reviewText: ok, so this is NOT for people who don't have a lot of strength and who are not to easy with floor movements. Some of the camera work leaves a bit to be desired. Despite this I LOVE it.Every time I do this I feel strong! I feel like I am working my body. And I like how it feels.On the whole she cues it well, I like the little counter at the side which tells you how much you have to go. I just really, really, really like this DVD!the performance by tanna isn't so good. the camera work means you can't really see what she is doing.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This dvd delivered everything I'd hoped it would deliver in terms of instruction and sensuous moves.  With this dvd, anyone can learn how to add grace to floorwork moves by following and practicing the 3 sessions.The dvd is broken down  into 3 "sessions" where instruction and practice is given on moves and 3 "dance" sections where the instructor uses all of the moves in a dance. (No instructions or cueing is given during the dance sessions) Following these sessions is a performance by Tanna.In my opinion, the info on the anatomy of the moves could have been left out and in its place, instruction on arm movements could have been given and would have been very helpful. Also, beginning belly dance students might find that the movements are done too quickly and without time for much repetition within the session, but the moves are used again in each session.I feel this dvd is a good buy for beginning dancers who want to learn and practice floorwork. The moves will make you feel and look sexy and exotic!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I have over 25 bellydance dvds I've collected in the past 4 years just for fitness.This is definitly not for beginners in terms of holding your body up on your arms & feet alone while doing uludations, hips circles & twists, etc. You will need to be at least somewhat active & workout regularly before buying this.If you have Neon's Bellydance for Body Shaping, you know the instruction & pace style.There is a 20 min tutorial w/no music on hip circles, etc. but still not enough for a first-time bellydance dvd buyer or even a second dvd. I would still suggest Veena & Neena the bellydance twins first since they go the slowest & use analogies.It's broke down into 3 warmup, teaching, dance & cooldown all in 15 min each. There is soft soothing music playing the during the first 13 min of the session & the more heavy beat good music for the end dance.I agree with another reviewer that though Tanna is good, she's still a little stiff & feels "by the book" in her movements like she's still a little unsure. Tanna is very nice & personable & is very enerst when she says to just do the best you can.The dance routines you learn I felt were a little uninspiring & the bonus workout of Tanna dancing solo with full costume at the end seemed to need the extra camerawork that moves a lot & changes back & forth to cover up her inexperience.
summary: Pretty good, very different, great toning benefits
